en-US.description: Code Approve lets you approve or deny AI coding assistant permission requests by voice through your Alexa device. When your coding assistant needs permission to run a command, edit a file, or perform other actions, you'll get a notification on your Echo device. Simply say 'approve' or 'deny' to respond hands-free. You can also switch between voice mode and text mode, or disable notifications entirely.
examplePhrases: Alexa, ask Code Approve to check pending
en-US.name: Code Approve
en-US.summary: Voice approval for AI coding assistant permission requests.

publishingInformation.testingInstructions: This skill is used with a CLI tool that sends permission requests to an API. To test: 1) Say 'Alexa, open Code Approve' - should respond with 'No pending requests right now.' 2) Say 'check pending' - should respond with no pending requests. 3) Say 'approve' or 'deny' when no request is pending - should respond appropriately. 4) Say 'enable voice mode' - should confirm voice mode enabled. 5) Say 'status' - should report current mode.
